summary: The Child Care Modernization Act of 2025 aims to reauthorize and update the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. Key provisions include redefining terms, reauthorizing appropriations, and revising state plan requirements. The bill focuses on increasing the supply and quality of child care, promoting parental choice, and providing financial assistance through grants to improve child care facilities and expand access. It also includes stipulations for state plans, waivers, reporting, and technical amendments related to child care services.
